contextId.information: In this phrase, "look" is a command meaning "pay attention!" AT: "Look! He is baptizing" or "Look at that! He is baptizing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: look, he is baptizing

contextId.information: The words "explain everything" imply all that the people need to know. AT: "he will tell us everything we need to know" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he will explain everything to us

contextId.information: It is implied in the text that Jesus traveled by boat and took his disciples with him. AT: "Jesus traveled by boat with his disciples" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Jesus went away

contextId.information: It is implied that Jesus gets into the boat. AT: "they gladly received him into the boat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they were willing to receive him into the boat

contextId.information: Here Jesus is implying that if he goes to Jerusalem, he will bring his work to an end. AT: "It is not the right time for me to go to Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: my time has not yet been fulfilled

contextId.information: Jesus implies that the act of circumcision also involves work. AT: "you circumcise a male baby on the Sabbath. That is working too!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: on the Sabbath you circumcise a man

contextId.information: Jesus implies that the people should not decide what is right, based only on what they can see. Behind the action is a motive that cannot be seen. AT: "Stop judging people according to what you see! Be more concerned with what is right according to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Do not judge according to appearance, but judge righteously

contextId.information: Jesus and the people were actually in the courtyard of the temple. AT: "in the temple courtyard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: in the temple

contextId.information: John implies that the Spirit would later come to live in those who trusted Jesus. AT: "the Spirit had not yet come to live in the believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the Spirit had not yet been given

contextId.information: What they would accuse him of can be made explicit. AT: "so that they could accuse him of saying something wrong" or "so that they could accuse him of not obeying the law of Moses or the Roman law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: so that they might have something to accuse him about

contextId.information: The Pharisees are implying that the witness of only one person is not true because it cannot be verified. AT: "you cannot be your own witness" or "what you say about yourself may not be true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: your witness is not true

contextId.information: The Father also bears witness about Jesus. You could make it explicit that this means Jesus' testimony is true. AT: "my Father who sent me also brings evidence about me. So you should believe that what we tell you is true" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the Father who sent me bears witness about me

contextId.information: Jesus implies that their father is the devil. AT: "No! You are doing the things that your real father did" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You do the works of your father

contextId.information: Here the Jewish leaders imply that Jesus does not know who his real father is. AT: "We do not know about you, but we are not illegitimate children" (UDB) or "We were all born from proper marriages" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: We were not born in sexual immorality

contextId.information: The Jewish leaders are outraged at what Jesus has said. Here it is implied that they wanted to kill him because he had made himself equal to God. AT: "Then they picked up stones to kill him because he claimed to be equal with God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Then they picked up stones to throw at him

contextId.information: This question reflects the ancient Jewish belief that sin caused all illnesses and other deformities. The rabbis also taught that it was possible for a baby to sin while still in the womb. AT: "Teacher, we know that sin causes a person to be blind. Whose sin caused this man to be born blind? did this man himself sin, or was it his parents who sinned?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who sinned, this man or his parents ... blind?

contextId.information: Jesus used his fingers to mix the dirt and saliva. AT: "and used his fingers to mix the dirt and saliva to make mud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: made mud with the saliva

contextId.information: Here the Jewish leaders are referring to Jesus. They imply that he has no authority to call disciples. AT: "we do not know where he comes from or where he gets his authority!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: we do not know where this one is from

contextId.information: The area where Jesus was walking was actually a courtyard that was outside the temple building. AT: "Jesus was walking in the temple courtyard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Jesus was walking in the temple

contextId.information: Jesus implies that he knows what will happen related to Lazarus and his sickness. AT: "Death will not be the final result of this sickness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: This sickness is not to death

contextId.information: Jesus implies that he knows what the outcome will be. AT: "but the purpose is that the people might see how great God is because of what his power will allow me to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: instead it is for the glory of God so that the Son of God may be glorified by it

contextId.information: Lazarus was the younger brother. AT: "my younger brother would still be alive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: my brother would not have died

contextId.information: Mary is the younger sister of Martha. AT: "she went away and called her younger sister Mary" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: she went away and called her sister Mary

contextId.information: It is implied here that the council members are talking about Jesus. AT: "What are we going to do about Jesus?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: What will we do?

contextId.information: Caiaphas implies that the Roman army would kill all of the people of the Jewish nation if Jesus is allowed to live and cause a rebellion. The word "nation" here is a synecdoche that represents all of the Jewish people. AT: "than that the Romans kill all the people of our nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: than that the whole nation perishes

contextId.information: Jesus and his disciples stayed in Ephraim for a while. AT: "There he stayed with his disciples for a short period of time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: There he stayed with the disciples

contextId.information: Jesus implies that the woman's actions can be understood as anticipating his death and burial. AT: "Allow her to show how much she appreciates me! In this way she has prepared my body for burial" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Allow her to keep what she has for the day of my burial

contextId.information: In this way, Jesus implies that he will die. AT: "But I will not always be here with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But you will not always have me

contextId.information: This implies that many of the Jewish people were trusting in Jesus as the Son of God. AT: "were putting their trust in Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: believed in Jesus

contextId.information: The Pharisees imply here that it might be impossible to stop Jesus. AT: "It seems like we can do nothing to stop him!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Look, you can do nothing

contextId.information: Jesus implies that it is now the right time for God to honor the Son of Man through his upcoming suffering, death and resurrection. AT: "God will soon honor me when I die and rise again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified

contextId.information: Here "loves his life" means to consider one's own physical life to be more valuable than the lives of others. AT: "whoever values his own life more than others will not receive eternal life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: He who loves his life will lose it

contextId.information: Jesus implies that those who serve him will be with him in heaven. AT: "when I am in heaven, my servant will also be there with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: where I am, there will my servant also be

contextId.information: Here John implies that a crowd of people had gathered to hear Jesus speak. AT: "Jesus shouted out to the crowd that had gathered." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Jesus cried out and said

contextId.information: Here "to judge the world" implies condemnation. Jesus did not come to condemn people. AT: "If anyone hears my teaching and rejects it, I do not condemn him. I have not come to condemn people. Instead, I have come to save those who trust in me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: If anyone hears my words but does not keep them, I do not judge him; for I have not come to judge the world, but to save the world

contextId.information: Here Jesus implies that his disciples have great respect for him. AT: "You show me great respect when you call me 'teacher' and 'Lord.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You call me 'teacher' and 'Lord,'

contextId.information: During the time of Christ, Jews would often dine together in the Greek style, in which they lay on their sides on low couches. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: lying down at the table

contextId.information: People can come to God and live with him only by trusting Jesus. AT: "No one can come to the Father and live with him unless he comes through me." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: no one comes to the Father except through me

contextId.information: Here Jesus implies that he will not leave his disciples with no one to care for them. AT: "leave you with no one to care for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: leave you alone

contextId.information: The Father and the Son will share life with those who obey what Jesus commands. AT: "we will come to live with him, and will have a personal relationship with him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: we will come to him and we will make our home with him

contextId.information: Here Jesus implies that he will return to his Father. AT: "I am going back to the Father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I am going to the Father

contextId.information: Here Jesus implies that the Father has greater authority than the Son while the Son is on the earth. AT: "the Father has greater authority than I have here."  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the Father is greater than I

contextId.information: "You show that you are my friends if you keep doings what I have commanded you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You are my friends if you do the things that I command you

contextId.information: Jesus implies that his followers did not decide on their own to become his disciples. AT: "You did not decide to become my disciples" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You did not choose me

contextId.information: This is a title for the Holy Spirit. AT: "the Spirit who tells the truth about God and me." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the Spirit of truth

contextId.information: Here the phrase "fall away" implies to stop putting one's trust in Jesus. You can translate this in an active form. AT: "so that you would not stop trusting in me because of the difficulties you must face." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will not fall away

contextId.information: The "truth" refers to spiritual truth. AT: "he will teach you all the spiritual truth you need to know" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he will guide you into all the truth

contextId.information: Here "things of mine" refers to Jesus' teaching and mighty works. AT: "he will reveal to you that what I have said and done are indeed true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he will take from what is mine and he will tell it to you

contextId.information: The Holy Spirit will tell people that the words and works of Jesus are true. AT: "The Holy Spirit will tell everyone that my words and works are true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the Spirit will take from what is mine and he will tell it to you

contextId.information: Here "peace" refers to inner peace. AT: "so that you may have inner peace because of your relationship with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: so that you will have peace in me

contextId.information: Jesus had glory with God the Father "before the world was made" because Jesus is God the Son. AT: "Father, give me honor by bringing me into your presence as we were before we made the world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Father, glorify me ... with the glory that I had with you before the world was made

contextId.information: This refers to Judas, who betrayed Jesus. AT: "the one whom you long ago decided you would destroy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the son of destruction

contextId.information: The purpose for setting them apart can be stated clearly. The phrase "by the truth" here represents by teaching the truth. AT: "Make them your own people by teaching them the truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Set them apart by the truth

contextId.information: Here Jesus refers to the time before creation. AT: "before we created the world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: before the creation of the world

contextId.information: This was a grove of olive trees. AT: "where there was a grove of olive trees" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: where there was a garden

contextId.information: The word "he" is implied in the text. AT: "I am he" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I am

contextId.information: Here the word "he" is not present in the original text, but it is implied. AT: "I am he" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I am

contextId.information: Here "the word" refers to the words Jesus had prayed. You can translate this in an active form. AT: "This happened in order to fulfill the words that he had said when he was praying to his Father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This was in order to fulfil the word that he said

contextId.information: The soldiers tied Jesus' hands to prevent him from escaping. AT: "captured Jesus and tied him up to prevent him from escaping" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: seized Jesus and tied him up

contextId.information: Here "his teaching" refers to what Jesus had been teaching the people. AT: "about his disciples and what he had been teaching the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: about his disciples and his teaching

contextId.information: Here it is assumed the reader will remember that Jesus had said Peter would deny him before the rooster crowed. AT: "and immediately the rooster crowed, just as Jesus had said would happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and immediately the rooster crowed

contextId.information: Pilate was not a Jew, so if the Jewish leaders entered his headquarters, they would be defiled. This would have prevented them from celebrating the Passover. You can translate the double negative in a positive form. AT: "they themselves remained outside Pilate's headquarters because Pilate was a Gentile. They did not want to become defiled" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: they did not enter the government headquarters so that they would not be defiled

contextId.information: According to Roman law, the Jews could not put a man to death. AT: "According to Roman law, we cannot put a person to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: It is not lawful for us to put any man to death

contextId.information: Here "the truth" refers to the truth about God. AT: "tell people the truth about God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: bear witness to the truth

contextId.information: Pilate states this twice to say he does not believe Jesus is not guilty of any crime. He does not want to punish him. AT: "I see no reason to punish him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I find no guilt in him

contextId.information: Here "this answer" refers to Jesus' answer. AT: "When Pilate heard Jesus' answer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: At this answer

contextId.information: The form of "tried" in the original indicates that Pilate tried "hard" or "repeatedly" to release Jesus. AT: "he tried hard to release Jesus" or "he tried again and again to release Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Pilate tried to release him

contextId.information: Here "Jews" is a synecdoche that refers to the Jewish leaders that opposed Jesus. In the original, the form of "cried out" indicates that they cried out or shouted repeatedly. AT: "but the Jewish leaders kept shouting" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: but the Jews cried out

contextId.information: The chief priests had to go back to Pilate's headquarters to protest to him about the words on the sign. AT: "The chief priests went back to Pilate and said" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate

contextId.information: The soldiers will gamble and the winner will receive the shirt. AT: "let us gamble for the tunic and the winner will get to keep it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: let us cast lots for it to decide whose it will be

contextId.information: John implies here that Jesus gave his spirit back to God. AT: "He bowed his head and gave God his spirit" or "He bowed his head and died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: He bowed his head and gave up his spirit

contextId.information: Here "believe" means to put one's trust in Jesus. AT: "so that you will also put your trust in Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: so that you would also believe

contextId.information: John implies that Joseph of Arimathea wants to bury the body of Jesus. AT: "for permission to take the body of Jesus down from the cross for burial" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: if he could take away the body of Jesus

contextId.information: Mary Magdalene thinks that someone has stolen the Lord's body. AT: "Someone has taken the Lord's body out of the tomb" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: They took away the Lord out from the tomb

contextId.information: John implies that these disciples were going to the tomb. AT: "rushed out to the tomb" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: went out

contextId.information: When he saw that the tomb was empty, he believed that Jesus had risen from the dead. AT: "he saw these things and began to believe that Jesus had risen from the dead" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he saw and believed

contextId.information: The disciples continued to stay in Jerusalem. AT: "went back to where they were staying in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: went back home again

contextId.information: The angels were wearing white clothing. AT: "She saw two angels dressed in white clothing" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: She saw two angels in white

contextId.information: Here the word "him" refers to Jesus. AT: "If you have taken away the body of Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Sir, if you have taken him away

contextId.information: Mary Magdalene wants to get Jesus' body and bury it again. AT: "and I will get the body and bury it again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and I will take him away

contextId.information: Jesus rose from the dead and then predicted he would go up into heaven, back to his Father, who is God. AT: "I am about to return to heaven to be with my Father and your Father, to the one who is my God and your God" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I will go up to my Father and your Father, and my God and your God

contextId.information: Mary Magdalene went to where the disciples were staying and told them what she had seen and heard. AT: "Mary Magdalene went to where the disciples were and told them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples

contextId.information: Here "Jews" is a synecdoche for the Jewish leaders who might arrest the disciples. AT: "because they were afraid that the Jewish leaders might arrest them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for fear of the Jews

contextId.information: Jesus showed the disciples his wounds. AT: "he showed them the wounds in his hands and his side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he showed them his hands and his side

contextId.information: Here "believe" means to trust in Jesus. AT: "put your trust in me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: but believe

contextId.information: Thomas believes that Jesus is alive because he has seen him. AT: "you have believed that I am alive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: you have believed

contextId.information: This means those who have not seen Jesus. AT: "who have not seen me alive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who have not seen

contextId.information: Here "some" refers to fish. AT: "you will catch some fish in your net" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: you will find some

contextId.information: Peter jumped into the water and swam to shore. AT: "and jumped into the sea and swam to shore" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and threw himself into the sea

contextId.information: Here the word "follow" means "to be a disciple." AT: "Keep on being my disciple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Follow me

contextId.information: Here "testifies" means that he personally sees something. AT: "who has seen all these things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who testifies about these things
